> I don't believe that the notion of a resource's state makes any sense
> wrt abstract concepts so why would REST allow me to TRANSFER
> REPRESENTATIONS OF THE STATES of cars, dogs or even believes?

How do you think about abstract concepts like "3"?  Do you think of
it symbolically (the glyph) or numerically?  If you need to explain
to someone the algorithm for calculating the area of a circle, how
do you do that?  Those are all representations.

> While POSTing to 'presidential democracy' IMHO *obviously* makes
> no sense I also have serious problems with the idea of GETing a
> representation of the state of 'presidential democracy'.

Then don't provide one.  There is no requirement that all resources
have representations.

> So, why does REST ("REpresentational State Transfer"!) include the
> notion of abstract concepts in the definition of resource?

Because they are resources.

....Roy
